 2371: t_map_encode_decode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2372:     <<131,116,0,0,0,0>> = erlang:term_to_binary(#{}),
 2373:     Pairs = [
 2374: 	{a,b},{"key","values"},{<<"key">>,<<"value">>},
 2375: 	{1,b},{[atom,1],{<<"wat">>,1,2,3}},
 2376: 	{aa,"values"},
 2377: 	{1 bsl 64 + (1 bsl 50 - 1), sc1},
 2378: 	{99, sc2},
 2379: 	{1 bsl 65 + (1 bsl 51 - 1), sc3},
 2380: 	{88, sc4},
 2381: 	{1 bsl 66 + (1 bsl 52 - 1), sc5},
 2382: 	{77, sc6},
 2383: 	{1 bsl 67 + (1 bsl 53 - 1), sc3},
 2384: 	{75, sc6}, {-10,sc8},
 2385: 	{<<>>, sc9}, {3.14158, sc10},
 2386: 	{[3.14158], sc11}, {more_atoms, sc12},
 2387: 	{{more_tuples}, sc13}, {self(), sc14},
 2388: 	{{},{}},{[],[]},
 2389:         {map_s, #{a=>a, 2=>b, 3=>c}},
 2390:         {map_l, maps:from_list([{I,I}||I <- lists:seq(1,74)])}
 2391:     ],
 2392:     ok = map_encode_decode_and_match(Pairs,[],#{}),
 2393: 
 2394:     %% check sorting
 2395: 
 2396:     %% literally #{ b=>2, a=>1 } in the internal order
 2397:     #{ a:=1, b:=2 } =
 2398: 	erlang:binary_to_term(<<131,116,0,0,0,2,100,0,1,98,97,2,100,0,1,97,97,1>>),
 2399: 
 2400: 
 2401:     %% literally #{ "hi" => "value", a=>33, b=>55 } in the internal order
 2402:     #{ a:=33, b:=55, "hi" := "value"} = erlang:binary_to_term(<<131,116,0,0,0,3,
 2403: 	107,0,2,104,105,            % "hi" :: list()
 2404: 	107,0,5,118,97,108,117,101, % "value" :: list()
 2405: 	100,0,1,97,                 % a :: atom()
 2406: 	97,33,                      % 33 :: integer()
 2407: 	100,0,1,98,                 % b :: atom()
 2408: 	97,55                       % 55 :: integer()
 2409: 	>>),
 2410: 
 2411:     %% Maps of different sizes
 2412:     lists:foldl(fun(Key, M0) ->
 2413: 			M1 = M0#{Key => Key},
 2414: 			case Key rem 17 of
 2415: 			    0 ->
 2416: 				M1 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(M1)),
 2417:                                 M1 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(M1, [deterministic]));
 2418: 			    _ ->
 2419: 				ok
 2420: 			end,
 2421: 			M1
 2422: 		end,
 2423: 		#{},
 2424: 		lists:seq(1,10000)),
 2425: 
 2426:     %% many maps in same binary
 2427:     MapList = lists:foldl(fun(K, [M|_]=Acc) -> [M#{K => K} | Acc] end,
 2428: 			  [#{}],
 2429: 			  lists:seq(1,100)),
 2430:     MapList = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(MapList)),
 2431:     MapListR = lists:reverse(MapList),
 2432:     MapListR = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(MapListR)),
 2433: 
 2434:     %% error cases
 2435:     %% template: <<131,116,0,0,0,2,100,0,1,97,100,0,1,98,97,1,97,1>>
 2436:     %% which is: #{ a=>1, b=>1 }
 2437: 
 2438:     %% uniqueness violation
 2439:     %% literally #{ a=>1, "hi"=>"value", a=>2 }
 2440:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{_,_,_,_}|_]}} = (catch
 2441: 	erlang:binary_to_term(<<131,116,0,0,0,3,
 2442: 			       100,0,1,97,
 2443: 			       97,1,
 2444: 			       107,0,2,104,105,
 2445: 			       107,0,5,118,97,108,117,101,
 2446: 			       100,0,1,97,
 2447: 			       97,2>>)),
 2448: 
 2449:     %% bad size (too large)
 2450:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{_,_,_,_}|_]}} = (catch
 2451: 	erlang:binary_to_term(<<131,116,0,0,0,12,100,0,1,97,97,1,100,0,1,98,97,1>>)),
 2452: 
 2453:     %% bad size (too small) .. should fail just truncate it .. weird.
 2454:     %% possibly change external format so truncated will be #{a:=1}
 2455:     #{ a:=b } = erlang:binary_to_term(<<131,116,0,0,0,1,100,0,1,97,100,0,1,98,97,1,97,1>>),
 2456: 
 2457:     %% specific fannerl (opensource app) binary_to_term error in 18.1
 2458: 
 2459:     #{bias := {1,1,0},
 2460:       bit_fail := 0,
 2461:       connections := #{{2,9}   := _,
 2462:                        {8,14}  := _,
 2463:                        {2,12}  := _,
 2464:                        {5,7}   := _,
 2465:                        {11,16} := _,
 2466:                        {11,15} := _},
 2467:       layers := {5,7,3},
 2468:       network_type := fann_nettype_layer,
 2469:       num_input := 5,
 2470:       num_layers := 3,
 2471:       num_output := 3,
 2472:       rprop_delta_max := _,
 2473:       rprop_delta_min := _,
 2474:       total_connections := 66,
 2475:       total_neurons := 17,
 2476:       train_error_function := fann_errorfunc_tanh,
 2477:       train_stop_function := fann_stopfunc_mse,
 2478:       training_algorithm := fann_train_rprop} = erlang:binary_to_term(fannerl()),
 2479:     ok.
 2480: 
 2481: map_encode_decode_and_match([{K,V}|Pairs], EncodedPairs, M0) ->
 2482:     M1 = maps:put(K,V,M0),
 2483:     B0 = erlang:term_to_binary(M1),
 2484:     Ls = [{erlang:term_to_binary(K), erlang:term_to_binary(V)}|EncodedPairs],
 2485:     ok = match_encoded_map(B0, length(Ls), Ls),
 2486:     %% decode and match it
 2487:     M1 = erlang:binary_to_term(B0),
 2488:     map_encode_decode_and_match(Pairs,Ls,M1);
 2489: map_encode_decode_and_match([],_,_) -> ok.
 2490: 
 2491: match_encoded_map(<<131,116,Size:32,Encoded/binary>>,Size,Items) ->
 2492:     match_encoded_map_stripped_size(Encoded,Items,Items);
 2493: match_encoded_map(_,_,_) -> no_match_size.
 2494: 
 2495: match_encoded_map_stripped_size(<<>>,_,_) -> ok;
 2496: match_encoded_map_stripped_size(B0,[{<<131,K/binary>>,<<131,V/binary>>}|Items],Ls) ->
 2497:     Ksz = byte_size(K),
 2498:     Vsz = byte_size(V),
 2499:     case B0 of
 2500: 	<<K:Ksz/binary,V:Vsz/binary,B1/binary>> ->
 2501: 	    match_encoded_map_stripped_size(B1,Ls,Ls);
 2502: 	_ ->
 2503: 	    match_encoded_map_stripped_size(B0,Items,Ls)
 2504:     end;
 2505: match_encoded_map_stripped_size(_,[],_) -> fail.
 2506: 
 2507: 
 2508: t_bif_map_to_list(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2509:     [] = maps:to_list(#{}),
 2510:     [{a,1},{b,2}] = lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{a=>1,b=>2})),
 2511:     [{a,1},{b,2},{c,3}] = lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{c=>3,a=>1,b=>2})),
 2512:     [{a,1},{b,2},{g,3}] = lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{g=>3,a=>1,b=>2})),
 2513:     [{a,1},{b,2},{g,3},{"c",4}] = lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{g=>3,a=>1,b=>2,"c"=>4})),
 2514:     [{3,v2},{hi,v4},{{hi,3},v5},{"hi",v3},{<<"hi">>,v1}] =
 2515: 	lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{<<"hi">>=>v1,3=>v2,"hi"=>v3,hi=>v4,{hi,3}=>v5})),
 2516: 
 2517:     [{3,v7},{hi,v9},{{hi,3},v10},{"hi",v8},{<<"hi">>,v6}] =
 2518: 	lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{<<"hi">>=>v1,3=>v2,"hi"=>v3,hi=>v4,{hi,3}=>v5,
 2519: 				  <<"hi">>=>v6,3=>v7,"hi"=>v8,hi=>v9,{hi,3}=>v10})),
 2520: 
 2521:     %% error cases
 2522:     do_badmap(fun(T) ->
 2523: 		      {'EXIT', {{badmap,T},_}} =
 2524: 			  (catch maps:to_list(T))
 2525: 	      end),
 2526:     ok.
 2527: 
 2528: 
 2529: t_bif_map_from_list(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2530:     #{} = maps:from_list([]),
 2531:     A   = maps:from_list([]),
 2532:     0   = erlang:map_size(A),
 2533: 
 2534:     #{a:=1,b:=2}      = maps:from_list([{a,1},{b,2}]),
 2535:     #{c:=3,a:=1,b:=2} = maps:from_list([{a,1},{b,2},{c,3}]),
 2536:     #{g:=3,a:=1,b:=2} = maps:from_list([{a,1},{b,2},{g,3}]),
 2537: 
 2538:     #{a:=2} = maps:from_list([{a,1},{a,3},{a,2}]),
 2539: 
 2540:     #{ <<"hi">>:=v1,3:=v3,"hi":=v6,hi:=v4,{hi,3}:=v5} =
 2541: 	maps:from_list([{3,v3},{"hi",v6},{hi,v4},{{hi,3},v5},{<<"hi">>,v1}]),
 2542: 
 2543:     #{<<"hi">>:=v6,3:=v8,"hi":=v11,hi:=v9,{hi,3}:=v10} =
 2544: 	maps:from_list([ {{hi,3},v3}, {"hi",v0},{3,v1}, {<<"hi">>,v4}, {hi,v2},
 2545: 	    {<<"hi">>,v6}, {{hi,3},v10},{"hi",v11}, {hi,v9}, {3,v8}]),
 2546: 
 2547:     %% repeated keys (large -> small)
 2548:     Ps1 = [{a,I}|| I <- lists:seq(1,32)],
 2549:     Ps2 = [{a,I}|| I <- lists:seq(33,64)],
 2550: 
 2551:     M = maps:from_list(Ps1 ++ [{b,1},{c,1}] ++ Ps2),
 2552:     #{ a := 64, b := 1, c := 1 } = M,
 2553: 
 2554:     %% error cases
 2555:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id([{a,b},b]))),
 2556:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id([{a,b},{b,b,3}]))),
 2557:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id([{a,b},<<>>]))),
 2558:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id([{a,b}|{b,a}]))),
 2559:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id(a))),
 2560:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id(42))),
 2561:     ok.
 2562: 
 2563: t_bif_map_next(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2564: 
 2565:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 2566: 
 2567:     try
 2568: 
 2569:         none = maps:next(maps:iterator(id(#{}))),
 2570: 
 2571:         verify_iterator(#{}),
 2572:         verify_iterator(#{a => 1, b => 2, c => 3}),
 2573: 
 2574:         %% Use fatmap in order to test iterating in very deep maps
 2575:         FM = fatmap(43),
 2576:         verify_iterator(FM),
 2577: 
 2578:         {'EXIT', {{badmap,[{a,b},b]},_}} = (catch maps:iterator(id([{a,b},b]))),
 2579:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id(a))),
 2580:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([a|FM]))),
 2581:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([1|#{}]))),
 2582:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([-1|#{}]))),
 2583:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([-1|FM]))),
 2584:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([16#FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF|FM]))),
 2585:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([-16#FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF|FM]))),
 2586: 
 2587:         %% This us a whitebox test that the error code works correctly.
 2588:         %% It uses a path for a tree of depth 4 and tries to do next on
 2589:         %% each of those paths.
 2590:         (fun F(0) -> ok;
 2591:              F(N) ->
 2592:                  try maps:next([N|FM]) of
 2593:                      none ->
 2594:                          F(N-1);
 2595:                      {_K,_V,_I} ->
 2596:                          F(N-1)
 2597:                  catch error:badarg ->
 2598:                          F(N-1)
 2599:                  end
 2600:          end)(16#FFFF),
 2601: 
 2602:         ok
 2603:     after
 2604:             erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false)
 2605:     end.
 2606: 
 2607: verify_iterator(Map) ->
 2608:     KVs = t_fold(fun(K, V, A) -> [{K, V} | A] end, [], Map),
 2609: 
 2610:     %% Verify that KVs created by iterating Map is of
 2611:     %% correct size and contains all elements
 2612:     true = length(KVs) == maps:size(Map),
 2613:     [maps:get(K, Map) || {K, _} <- KVs],
 2614:     ok.
 2615: 
 2616: 
 2617: t_fold(Fun, Init, Map) ->
 2618:     t_fold_1(Fun, Init, maps:iterator(Map)).
 2619: 
 2620: t_fold_1(Fun, Acc, Iter) ->
 2621:     case maps:next(Iter) of
 2622:         {K, V, NextIter} ->
 2623:             t_fold_1(Fun, Fun(K,V,Acc), NextIter);
 2624:         none ->
 2625:             Acc
 2626:     end.
 2627: 
 2628: t_bif_build_and_check(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2629:     ok = check_build_and_remove(750,[fun(K) -> [K,K] end,
 2630: 				     fun(K) -> [float(K),K] end,
 2631: 				     fun(K) -> K end,
 2632: 				     fun(K) -> {1,K} end,
 2633: 				     fun(K) -> {K} end,
 2634: 				     fun(K) -> [K|K] end,
 2635: 				     fun(K) -> [K,1,2,3,4] end,
 2636: 				     fun(K) -> {K,atom} end,
 2637: 				     fun(K) -> float(K) end,
 2638: 				     fun(K) -> integer_to_list(K) end,
 2639: 				     fun(K) -> list_to_atom(integer_to_list(K)) end,
 2640: 				     fun(K) -> [K,{K,[K,{K,[K]}]}] end,
 2641: 				     fun(K) -> <<K:32>> end]),
 2642:     ok.
 2643: 
 2644: check_build_and_remove(_,[]) -> ok;
 2645: check_build_and_remove(N,[F|Fs]) ->
 2646:     {M,Ks} = build_and_check(N, maps:new(), F, []),
 2647:     ok     = remove_and_check(Ks,M),
 2648:     check_build_and_remove(N,Fs).
 2649: 
 2650: build_and_check(0, M0, _, Ks) -> {M0, Ks};
 2651: build_and_check(N, M0, F, Ks) ->
 2652:     K  = build_key(F,N),
 2653:     M1 = maps:put(K,K,M0),
 2654:     ok = check_keys_exist([I||{I,_} <- [{K,M1}|Ks]], M1),
 2655:     M2 = maps:update(K,v,M1),
 2656:     v  = maps:get(K,M2),
 2657:     build_and_check(N-1,M1,F,[{K,M1}|Ks]).
 2658: 
 2659: remove_and_check([],_) -> ok;
 2660: remove_and_check([{K,Mc}|Ks], M0) ->
 2661:     K     = maps:get(K,M0),
 2662:     true  = maps:is_key(K,M0),
 2663:     true  = Mc =:= M0,
 2664:     true  = M0 == Mc,
 2665:     M1    = maps:remove(K,M0),
 2666:     false = M1 =:= Mc,
 2667:     false = Mc == M1,
 2668:     false = maps:is_key(K,M1),
 2669:     true  = maps:is_key(K,M0),
 2670:     ok    = check_keys_exist([I||{I,_} <- Ks],M1),
 2671:     error = maps:find(K,M1),
 2672:     remove_and_check(Ks, M1).
 2673: 
 2674: build_key(F,N) when N rem 3 =:= 0 -> F(N);
 2675: build_key(F,N) when N rem 3 =:= 1 -> K = F(N), {K,K};
 2676: build_key(F,N) when N rem 3 =:= 2 -> K = F(N), [K,K].
 2677: 
 2678: check_keys_exist([], _) -> ok;
 2679: check_keys_exist([K|Ks],M) ->
 2680:     true = maps:is_key(K,M),
 2681:     check_keys_exist(Ks,M).
 2682: 
 2683: t_bif_merge_and_check(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2684: 
 2685:     io:format("rand:export_seed() -> ~p\n",[rand:export_seed()]),
 2686: 
 2687:     %% simple disjunct ones
 2688:     %% make sure all keys are unique
 2689:     Kss = [[a,b,c,d],
 2690: 	   [1,2,3,4],
 2691: 	   [],
 2692: 	   ["hi"],
 2693: 	   [e],
 2694: 	   [build_key(fun(K) -> {small,K} end, I) || I <- lists:seq(1,32)],
 2695: 	   lists:seq(5, 28),
 2696: 	   lists:seq(29, 59),
 2697: 	   [build_key(fun(K) -> integer_to_list(K) end, I) || I <- lists:seq(2000,10000)],
 2698: 	   [build_key(fun(K) -> <<K:32>> end, I) || I <- lists:seq(1,80)],
 2699: 	   [build_key(fun(K) -> {<<K:32>>} end, I) || I <- lists:seq(100,1000)]],
 2700: 
 2701: 
 2702:     KsMs = build_keys_map_pairs(Kss),
 2703:     Cs   = [{CKs1,CM1,CKs2,CM2} || {CKs1,CM1} <- KsMs, {CKs2,CM2} <- KsMs],
 2704:     ok   = merge_and_check_combo(Cs),
 2705: 
 2706:     %% overlapping ones
 2707: 
 2708:     KVs1 = [{a,1},{b,2},{c,3}],
 2709:     KVs2 = [{b,3},{c,4},{d,5}],
 2710:     KVs  = [{I,I} || I <- lists:seq(1,32)],
 2711:     KVs3 = KVs1 ++ KVs,
 2712:     KVs4 = KVs2 ++ KVs,
 2713: 
 2714:     M1  = maps:from_list(KVs1),
 2715:     M2  = maps:from_list(KVs2),
 2716:     M3  = maps:from_list(KVs3),
 2717:     M4  = maps:from_list(KVs4),
 2718: 
 2719:     M12 = maps:merge(M1,M2),
 2720:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs2 ++ [{a,1}], M12),
 2721:     M21 = maps:merge(M2,M1),
 2722:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs1 ++ [{d,5}], M21),
 2723: 
 2724:     M34 = maps:merge(M3,M4),
 2725:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs4 ++ [{a,1}], M34),
 2726:     M43 = maps:merge(M4,M3),
 2727:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs3 ++ [{d,5}], M43),
 2728: 
 2729:     M14 = maps:merge(M1,M4),
 2730:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs4 ++ [{a,1}], M14),
 2731:     M41 = maps:merge(M4,M1),
 2732:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs1 ++ [{d,5}] ++ KVs, M41),
 2733: 
 2734:     [begin Ma = random_map(SzA, a),
 2735: 	   Mb = random_map(SzB, b),
 2736: 	   ok = merge_maps(Ma, Mb)
 2737:      end || SzA <- [3,10,20,100,200,1000], SzB <- [3,10,20,100,200,1000]],
 2738: 
 2739:     ok.
 2740: 
 2741: % Generate random map with an average of Sz number of pairs: K -> {V,K}
 2742: random_map(Sz, V) ->
 2743:     random_map_insert(#{}, 0, V, Sz*2).
 2744: 
 2745: random_map_insert(M0, K0, _, Sz) when K0 > Sz ->
 2746:     M0;
 2747: random_map_insert(M0, K0, V, Sz) ->
 2748:     Key = K0 + rand:uniform(3),
 2749:     random_map_insert(M0#{Key => {V,Key}}, Key, V, Sz).
 2750: 
 2751: 
 2752: merge_maps(A, B) ->
 2753:     AB = maps:merge(A, B),
 2754:     %%io:format("A=~p\nB=~p\n",[A,B]),
 2755:     maps_foreach(fun(K,VB) -> VB = maps:get(K, AB)
 2756: 		 end, B),
 2757:     maps_foreach(fun(K,VA) ->
 2758: 			 case {maps:get(K, AB),maps:find(K, B)} of
 2759: 			     {VA, error} -> ok;
 2760: 			     {VB, {ok, VB}} -> ok
 2761: 			 end
 2762: 		 end, A),
 2763: 
 2764:     maps_foreach(fun(K,V) ->
 2765: 			 case {maps:find(K, A),maps:find(K, B)} of
 2766: 			     {{ok, V}, error} -> ok;
 2767: 			     {error, {ok, V}} -> ok;
 2768: 			     {{ok,_}, {ok, V}} -> ok
 2769: 			 end
 2770: 		 end, AB),
 2771:     ok.
 2772: 
 2773: maps_foreach(Fun, Map) ->
 2774:     maps:fold(fun(K,V,_) -> Fun(K,V) end, void, Map).
 2775: 
 2776: 
 2777: check_key_values([],_) -> ok;
 2778: check_key_values([{K,V}|KVs],M) ->
 2779:     V = maps:get(K,M),
 2780:     check_key_values(KVs,M).
 2781: 
 2782: merge_and_check_combo([]) -> ok;
 2783: merge_and_check_combo([{Ks1,M1,Ks2,M2}|Cs]) ->
 2784:     M12 = maps:merge(M1,M2),
 2785:     ok  = check_keys_exist(Ks1 ++ Ks2, M12),
 2786:     M21 = maps:merge(M2,M1),
 2787:     ok  = check_keys_exist(Ks1 ++ Ks2, M21),
 2788: 
 2789:     true = M12 =:= M21,
 2790:     M12  = M21,
 2791: 
 2792:     merge_and_check_combo(Cs).
 2793: 
 2794: build_keys_map_pairs([]) -> [];
 2795: build_keys_map_pairs([Ks|Kss]) ->
 2796:     M  = maps:from_list(keys_to_pairs(Ks)),
 2797:     ok = check_keys_exist(Ks, M),
 2798:     [{Ks,M}|build_keys_map_pairs(Kss)].
 2799: 
 2800: keys_to_pairs(Ks) -> [{K,K} || K <- Ks].
 2801: 
 2802: 
 2803: %% Maps module, not BIFs
 2804: t_maps_fold(_Config) ->
 2805:     Vs = lists:seq(1,100),
 2806:     M  = maps:from_list([{{k,I},{v,I}}||I<-Vs]),
 2807: 
 2808:     %% fold
 2809:     5050 = maps:fold(fun({k,_},{v,V},A) -> V + A end, 0, M),
 2810: 
 2811:     ok.
 2812: 
 2813: t_maps_map(_Config) ->
 2814:     Vs = lists:seq(1,100),
 2815:     M1 = maps:from_list([{I,I}||I<-Vs]),
 2816:     M2 = maps:from_list([{I,{token,I}}||I<-Vs]),
 2817: 
 2818:     M2 = maps:map(fun(_K,V) -> {token,V} end, M1),
 2819:     ok.
 2820: 
 2821: t_maps_size(_Config) ->
 2822:     Vs = lists:seq(1,100),
 2823:     lists:foldl(fun(I,M) ->
 2824: 		M1 = maps:put(I,I,M),
 2825: 		I  = maps:size(M1),
 2826: 		M1
 2827: 	end, #{}, Vs),
 2828:     ok.
 2829: 
 2830: 
 2831: t_maps_without(_Config) ->
 2832:     Ki = [11,22,33,44,55,66,77,88,99],
 2833:     M0 = maps:from_list([{{k,I},{v,I}}||I<-lists:seq(1,100)]),
 2834:     M1 = maps:from_list([{{k,I},{v,I}}||I<-lists:seq(1,100) -- Ki]),
 2835:     M1 = maps:without([{k,I}||I <- Ki],M0),
 2836:     ok.
 2837: 
 2838: 
 2839: %% MISC
 2840: 
 2841: %% Verify that the the number of nodes in hashmaps
 2842: %% of different types and sizes does not deviate too
 2843: %% much from the theoretical model.
 2844: %% For debug with DBG_HASHMAP_COLLISION_BONANZA the test will expect
 2845: %% the hashmaps to NOT be well balanced.
 2846: t_hashmap_balance(_Config) ->
 2847:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 2848:     ExpectBalance = not erts_debug:get_internal_state(hashmap_collision_bonanza),
 2849:     hashmap_balance(ExpectBalance),
 2850:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
 2851:     ok.
 2852: 
 2853: hashmap_balance(EB) ->
 2854:     io:format("Integer keys\n", []),
 2855:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> I end, EB),
 2856:     io:format("Float keys\n", []),
 2857:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> float(I) end, EB),
 2858:     io:format("String keys\n", []),
 2859:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> integer_to_list(I) end, EB),
 2860:     io:format("Binary (big) keys\n", []),
 2861:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> <<I:16/big>> end, EB),
 2862:     io:format("Binary (little) keys\n", []),
 2863:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> <<I:16/little>> end, EB),
 2864:     io:format("Atom keys\n", []),
 2865:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> erts_debug:get_internal_state({atom,I}) end, EB),
 2866:     ok.
 2867: 
 2868: hashmap_balance(KeyFun, ExpectBalance) ->
 2869:     %% For uniformly distributed hash values, the average number of nodes N
 2870:     %% in a hashmap varies between 0.3*K and 0.4*K where K is number of keys.
 2871:     %% The standard deviation of N is about sqrt(K)/3.
 2872: 
 2873:     %% For simplicity we use the higher expected average 0.4*K
 2874:     %% and verfies that no map is too many standard deviation above it.
 2875: 
 2876:     F = fun(I, {M0,Max0}) ->
 2877: 		Key = KeyFun(I),
 2878: 		M1 = M0#{Key => Key},
 2879: 		Max1 = case erts_internal:term_type(M1) of
 2880: 			   hashmap ->
 2881: 			       Nodes = hashmap_nodes(M1),
 2882: 			       Avg = maps:size(M1) * 0.4,
 2883: 			       StdDev = math:sqrt(maps:size(M1)) / 3,
 2884: 			       SD_diff = abs(Nodes - Avg) / StdDev,
 2885: 			       %%io:format("~p keys: ~p nodes avg=~p SD_diff=~p\n",
 2886: 			       %%          [maps:size(M1), Nodes, Avg, SD_diff]),
 2887: 			       {MaxDiff0, _, Cnt} = Max0,
 2888: 			       case {Nodes > Avg, SD_diff > MaxDiff0} of
 2889: 				   {true, true} -> {SD_diff, M1, Cnt+1};
 2890: 				   _ -> Max0
 2891: 			       end;
 2892: 
 2893: 			   flatmap -> Max0
 2894: 		       end,
 2895: 		{M1, Max1}
 2896: 	end,
 2897: 
 2898:     {_,{MaxDiff,MaxMap, FatCnt}} = lists:foldl(F,
 2899: 					       {#{}, {0, undefined, 0}},
 2900: 					       lists:seq(1,10000)),
 2901:     case MaxMap of
 2902: 	undefined ->
 2903: 	    io:format("Wow, no map with more than \"average\" number of nodes\n");
 2904: 	_ ->
 2905: 	    io:format("Found ~p maps with more than \"average\" number of nodes\n",
 2906: 		      [FatCnt]),
 2907: 	    io:format("Max std dev diff ~p for map of size ~p (nodes=~p, flatsize=~p)\n",
 2908: 		      [MaxDiff, maps:size(MaxMap), hashmap_nodes(MaxMap),
 2909: 		       erts_debug:flat_size(MaxMap)])
 2910:     end,
 2911: 
 2912:     %% The probability of this line failing is about 0.000000001
 2913:     %% for a uniform hash. I've set the probability this "high" for now
 2914:     %% to detect flaws in our make_internal_hash.
 2915:     ExpectBalance = (MaxDiff < 6),
 2916:     ok.
 2917: 
 2918: hashmap_nodes(M) ->
 2919:     Info = erts_debug:map_info(M),
 2920:     lists:foldl(fun(Tpl,Acc) ->
 2921: 			case element(1,Tpl) of
 2922: 			    bitmaps -> Acc + element(2,Tpl);
 2923: 			    arrays -> Acc + element(2,Tpl);
 2924: 			    collisions -> Acc + element(2,Tpl);
 2925: 			    _ -> Acc
 2926: 			end
 2927: 		end,
 2928: 		0,
 2929: 		Info).
 2930: 
 2931: t_erts_internal_order(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 2932: 
 2933:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1,2),
 2934:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(2,1),
 2935:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(2,2),
 2936: 
 2937: 
 2938:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1,a),
 2939:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(a,1),
 2940:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(a,a),
 2941: 
 2942:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1,1.0),
 2943:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(1.0,1),
 2944:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(1.0,1.0),
 2945: 
 2946:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1,1 bsl 65),
 2947:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(1 bsl 65,1),
 2948:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(1 bsl 65, 1 bsl 65),
 2949: 
 2950:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1 bsl 65,float(1)),
 2951:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(float(1),1 bsl 65),
 2952:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1,float(1 bsl 65)),
 2953:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(float(1 bsl 65),1),
 2954:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(float(1 bsl 65), float(1 bsl 65)),
 2955: 
 2956:     %% reported errors
 2957:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(0,2147483648),
 2958:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(2147483648,2147483648),
 2959:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(2147483648,0),
 2960: 
 2961:     M = #{0 => 0,2147483648 => 0},
 2962:     true = M =:= binary_to_term(term_to_binary(M)),
 2963:     true = M =:= binary_to_term(term_to_binary(M, [deterministic])),
 2964: 
 2965:     F1 = fun(_, _) -> 0 end,
 2966:     F2 = fun(_, _) -> 1 end,
 2967:     M0 = maps:from_list( [{-2147483649, 0}, {0,0}, {97, 0}, {false, 0}, {flower, 0}, {F1, 0}, {F2, 0}, {<<>>, 0}]),
 2968:     M1 = maps:merge(M0, #{0 => 1}),
 2969:     8  = maps:size(M1),
 2970:     1  = maps:get(0,M1),
 2971:     ok.
 2972: 
 2973: t_erts_internal_hash(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 2974:     K1 = 0.0,
 2975:     K2 = 0.0/-1,
 2976:     M  = maps:from_list([{I,I}||I<-lists:seq(1,32)]),
 2977: 
 2978:     M1 = M#{ K1 => a, K2 => b },
 2979:     b  = maps:get(K2,M1),
 2980: 
 2981:     M2 = M#{ K2 => a, K1 => b },
 2982:     b  = maps:get(K1,M2),
 2983: 
 2984:     %% test previously faulty hash list optimization
 2985: 
 2986:     M3 = M#{[0] => a, [0,0] => b, [0,0,0] => c, [0,0,0,0] => d},
 2987:     a  = maps:get([0],M3),
 2988:     b  = maps:get([0,0],M3),
 2989:     c  = maps:get([0,0,0],M3),
 2990:     d  = maps:get([0,0,0,0],M3),
 2991: 
 2992:     M4 = M#{{[0]} => a, {[0,0]} => b, {[0,0,0]} => c, {[0,0,0,0]} => d},
 2993:     a  = maps:get({[0]},M4),
 2994:     b  = maps:get({[0,0]},M4),
 2995:     c  = maps:get({[0,0,0]},M4),
 2996:     d  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0]},M4),
 2997: 
 2998:     M5 = M3#{[0,0,0] => e, [0,0,0,0] => f, [0,0,0,0,0] => g,
 2999:              [0,0,0,0,0,0] => h, [0,0,0,0,0,0,0] => i,
 3000:              [0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0] => j, [0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0] => k},
 3001: 
 3002:     a  = maps:get([0],M5),
 3003:     b  = maps:get([0,0],M5),
 3004:     e  = maps:get([0,0,0],M5),
 3005:     f  = maps:get([0,0,0,0],M5),
 3006:     g  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0],M5),
 3007:     h  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0],M5),
 3008:     i  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M5),
 3009:     j  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M5),
 3010:     k  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M5),
 3011: 
 3012:     M6 = M4#{{[0,0,0]} => e, {[0,0,0,0]} => f, {[0,0,0,0,0]} => g,
 3013:              {[0,0,0,0,0,0]} => h, {[0,0,0,0,0,0,0]} => i,
 3014:              {[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]} => j, {[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]} => k},
 3015: 
 3016:     a  = maps:get({[0]},M6),
 3017:     b  = maps:get({[0,0]},M6),
 3018:     e  = maps:get({[0,0,0]},M6),
 3019:     f  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3020:     g  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3021:     h  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3022:     i  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3023:     j  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3024:     k  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3025: 
 3026:     M7 = maps:merge(M5,M6),
 3027: 
 3028:     a  = maps:get([0],M7),
 3029:     b  = maps:get([0,0],M7),
 3030:     e  = maps:get([0,0,0],M7),
 3031:     f  = maps:get([0,0,0,0],M7),
 3032:     g  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0],M7),
 3033:     h  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0],M7),
 3034:     i  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M7),
 3035:     j  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M7),
 3036:     k  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M7),
 3037:     a  = maps:get({[0]},M7),
 3038:     b  = maps:get({[0,0]},M7),
 3039:     e  = maps:get({[0,0,0]},M7),
 3040:     f  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3041:     g  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3042:     h  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3043:     i  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3044:     j  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3045:     k  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3046: 
 3047:     %% Test that external pids and ports don't introduce hash clash,
 3048:     %% caused by high word being ignored (OTP-17436).
 3049:     maps:from_keys([erts_test_utils:mk_ext_pid({a@a, 17},
 3050: 					       1 bsl NumBit,
 3051: 					       1 bsl SerBit)
 3052: 		    || NumBit <- lists:seq(0, 31),
 3053: 		       SerBit <- lists:seq(0, 31)],
 3054: 		   1),
 3055:     maps:from_keys([erts_test_utils:mk_ext_port({a@a, 17}, 1 bsl NumBit)
 3056: 		    || NumBit <- lists:seq(0, 63)],
 3057: 		   1),
 3058: 
 3059:     ok.
 3060: 
 3061: t_pdict(_Config) ->
 3062: 
 3063:     put(#{ a => b, b => a},#{ c => d}),
 3064:     put(get(#{ a => b, b => a}),1),
 3065:     1 = get(#{ c => d}),
 3066:     #{ c := d } = get(#{ a => b, b => a}).
 3067: 
 3068: t_ets(_Config) ->
 3069: 
 3070:     Tid = ets:new(map_table,[]),
 3071: 
 3072:     [ets:insert(Tid,{maps:from_list([{I,-I}]),I}) || I <- lists:seq(1,100)],
 3073: 
 3074: 
 3075:     [{#{ 2 := -2},2}] = ets:lookup(Tid,#{ 2 => -2 }),
 3076: 
 3077:     %% Test equal
 3078:     [3,4] = lists:sort(
 3079: 	      ets:select(Tid,[{{'$1','$2'},
 3080: 			       [{'or',{'==','$1',#{ 3 => -3 }},
 3081: 				 {'==','$1',#{ 4 => -4 }}}],
 3082: 			       ['$2']}])),
 3083:     %% Test match
 3084:     [30,50] = lists:sort(
 3085: 		ets:select(Tid,
 3086: 			   [{{#{ 30 => -30}, '$1'},[],['$1']},
 3087: 			    {{#{ 50 => -50}, '$1'},[],['$1']}]
 3088: 			  )),
 3089: 
 3090:     ets:insert(Tid,{#{ a => b, b => c, c => a},transitivity}),
 3091: 
 3092:     %% Test equal with map of different size
 3093:     [] = ets:select(Tid,[{{'$1','_'},[{'==','$1',#{ b => c }}],['$_']}]),
 3094: 
 3095:     %% Test match with map of different size
 3096:     %[{#{ a := b },_}] = ets:select(Tid,[{{#{ b => c },'_'},[],['$_']}]),
 3097: 
 3098:     %%% Test match with don't care value
 3099:     %[{#{ a := b },_}] = ets:select(Tid,[{{#{ b => '_' },'_'},[],['$_']}]),
 3100: 
 3101:     %% Test is_map bif
 3102:     101 = length(ets:select(Tid,[{'$1',[{is_map,{element,1,'$1'}}],['$1']}])),
 3103:     ets:insert(Tid,{not_a_map,2}),
 3104:     101 = length(ets:select(Tid,[{'$1',[{is_map,{element,1,'$1'}}],['$1']}])),
 3105:     ets:insert(Tid,{{nope,a,tuple},2}),
 3106:     101 = length(ets:select(Tid,[{'$1',[{is_map,{element,1,'$1'}}],['$1']}])),
 3107: 
 3108:     %% Test map_size bif
 3109:     [3] = ets:select(Tid,[{{'$1','_'},[{'==',{map_size,'$1'},3}],
 3110: 			   [{map_size,'$1'}]}]),
 3111: 
 3112:     true = ets:delete(Tid,#{50 => -50}),
 3113:     [] = ets:lookup(Tid,#{50 => -50}),
 3114: 
 3115:     ets:delete(Tid),
 3116:     ok.
 3117: 
 3118: t_dets(_Config) ->
 3119:     ok.
 3120: 
 3121: t_tracing(_Config) ->
 3122: 
 3123:     dbg:stop_clear(),
 3124:     {ok,Tracer} = dbg:tracer(process,{fun trace_collector/2, self()}),
 3125:     dbg:p(self(),c),
 3126: 
 3127:     %% Test basic map call
 3128:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,x),
 3129:     id(#{ a => b }),
 3130:     {trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[#{ a := b }]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3131:     {trace,_,return_from,{?MODULE,id,1},#{ a := b }} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3132:     dbg:ctpl(),
 3133: 
 3134:     %% Test equals in argument list
 3135:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,[{['$1'],[{'==','$1',#{ b => c}}],
 3136: 				  [{return_trace}]}]),
 3137:     id(#{ a => b }),
 3138:     id(#{ b => c }),
 3139:     {trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[#{ b := c }]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3140:     {trace,_,return_from,{?MODULE,id,1},#{ b := c }} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3141:     dbg:ctpl(),
 3142: 
 3143:     %% Test match in head
 3144:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,[{[#{b => c}],[],[]}]),
 3145:     id(#{ a => b }),
 3146:     id(#{ b => c }),
 3147:     {trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[#{ b := c }]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3148:     dbg:ctpl(),
 3149: 
 3150:     % Test map guard bifs
 3151:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,[{['$1'],[{is_map,{element,1,'$1'}}],[]}]),
 3152:     id(#{ a => b }),
 3153:     id({1,2}),
 3154:     id({#{ a => b},2}),
 3155:     {trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[{#{ a := b },2}]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3156:     dbg:ctpl(),
 3157: 
 3158:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,[{['$1'],[{'==',{map_size,{element,1,'$1'}},2}],[]}]),
 3159:     id(#{ a => b }),
 3160:     id({1,2}),
 3161:     id({#{ a => b},2}),
 3162:     id({#{ a => b, b => c},atom}),
 3163:     {trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[{#{ a := b, b := c },atom}]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3164:     dbg:ctpl(),
 3165: 
 3166:     %MS = dbg:fun2ms(fun([A]) when A == #{ a => b} -> ok end),
 3167:     %dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,MS),
 3168:     %id(#{ a => b }),
 3169:     %id(#{ b => c }),
 3170:     %{trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[#{ a := b }]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3171:     %dbg:ctpl(),
 3172: 
 3173:     %% Check to extra messages
 3174:     timeout = getmsg(Tracer),
 3175: 
 3176:     dbg:stop_clear(),
 3177:     ok.
 3178: 
 3179: getmsg(_Tracer) ->
 3180:     receive V -> V after 100 -> timeout end.
 3181: 
 3182: trace_collector(Msg,Parent) ->
 3183:     io:format("~p~n",[Msg]),
 3184:     Parent ! Msg,
 3185:     Parent.
 3186: 
 3187: t_has_map_fields(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3188:     true = has_map_fields_1(#{one=>1}),
 3189:     true = has_map_fields_1(#{one=>1,two=>2}),
 3190:     false = has_map_fields_1(#{two=>2}),
 3191:     false = has_map_fields_1(#{}),
 3192: 
 3193:     true = has_map_fields_2(#{c=>1,b=>2,a=>3}),
 3194:     true = has_map_fields_2(#{c=>1,b=>2,a=>3,x=>42}),
 3195:     false = has_map_fields_2(#{b=>2,c=>1}),
 3196:     false = has_map_fields_2(#{x=>y}),
 3197:     false = has_map_fields_2(#{}),
 3198: 
 3199:     true = has_map_fields_3(#{c=>1,b=>2,a=>3}),
 3200:     true = has_map_fields_3(#{c=>1,b=>2,a=>3,[]=>42}),
 3201:     true = has_map_fields_3(#{b=>2,a=>3,[]=>42,42.0=>43}),
 3202:     true = has_map_fields_3(#{a=>3,[]=>42,42.0=>43}),
 3203:     true = has_map_fields_3(#{[]=>42,42.0=>43}),
 3204:     false = has_map_fields_3(#{b=>2,c=>1}),
 3205:     false = has_map_fields_3(#{[]=>y}),
 3206:     false = has_map_fields_3(#{42.0=>x,a=>99}),
 3207:     false = has_map_fields_3(#{}),
 3208: 
 3209:     ok.
 3210: 
 3211: has_map_fields_1(#{one:=_}) -> true;
 3212: has_map_fields_1(#{}) -> false.
 3213: 
 3214: has_map_fields_2(#{a:=_,b:=_,c:=_}) -> true;
 3215: has_map_fields_2(#{}) -> false.
 3216: 
 3217: has_map_fields_3(#{a:=_,b:=_}) -> true;
 3218: has_map_fields_3(#{[]:=_,42.0:=_}) -> true;
 3219: has_map_fields_3(#{}) -> false.
 3220: 
 3221: t_get_map_elements(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3222:     %% Tests that the JIT implementation of `get_map_elements` handles
 3223:     %% collisions properly.
 3224:     N = 500000,
 3225:     Is = lists:seq(1, N),
 3226:     Test = maps:from_list([{I,I}||I<-Is]),
 3227:     [begin
 3228:          #{ Key := Val } = Test,
 3229:          Key = Val
 3230:      end || Key <- Is],
 3231: 
 3232:     ok.
 3233: 
 3234: y_regs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3235:     Val = [length(Config)],
 3236:     Map0 = y_regs_update(#{}, Val),
 3237:     Map2 = y_regs_update(Map0, Val),
 3238: 
 3239:     Map3 = maps:from_list([{I,I*I} || I <- lists:seq(1, 100)]),
 3240:     Map4 = y_regs_update(Map3, Val),
 3241: 
 3242:     true = is_map(Map2) andalso is_map(Map4),
 3243: 
 3244:     gurka = y_regs_literal(0),
 3245:     gaffel = y_regs_literal(1),
 3246: 
 3247:     ok.
 3248: 
 3249: y_regs_literal(Key) when is_integer(Key) ->
 3250:     %% Forces the key to be placed in a Y register.
 3251:     lists:seq(1, 2),
 3252:     case is_map_key(Key, #{ 0 => 0 }) of
 3253:         true -> gurka;
 3254:         false -> gaffel
 3255:     end.
 3256: 
 3257: y_regs_update(Map0, Val0) ->
 3258:     Val1 = {t,Val0},
 3259:     K1 = id({key,1}),
 3260:     K2 = id({key,2}),
 3261:     Map1 = Map0#{K1=>K1,
 3262: 		 a=>Val0,b=>Val0,c=>Val0,d=>Val0,e=>Val0,
 3263: 		 f=>Val0,g=>Val0,h=>Val0,i=>Val0,j=>Val0,
 3264: 		 k=>Val0,l=>Val0,m=>Val0,n=>Val0,o=>Val0,
 3265: 		 p=>Val0,q=>Val0,r=>Val0,s=>Val0,t=>Val0,
 3266: 		 u=>Val0,v=>Val0,w=>Val0,x=>Val0,y=>Val0,
 3267: 		 z=>Val0,
 3268: 		 aa=>Val0,ab=>Val0,ac=>Val0,ad=>Val0,ae=>Val0,
 3269: 		 af=>Val0,ag=>Val0,ah=>Val0,ai=>Val0,aj=>Val0,
 3270: 		 ak=>Val0,al=>Val0,am=>Val0,an=>Val0,ao=>Val0,
 3271: 		 ap=>Val0,aq=>Val0,ar=>Val0,as=>Val0,at=>Val0,
 3272: 		 au=>Val0,av=>Val0,aw=>Val0,ax=>Val0,ay=>Val0,
 3273: 		 az=>Val0,
 3274: 		 K2=>[a,b,c]},
 3275:     Map2 = Map1#{K1=>K1,
 3276: 		 a:=Val1,b:=Val1,c:=Val1,d:=Val1,e:=Val1,
 3277: 		 f:=Val1,g:=Val1,h:=Val1,i:=Val1,j:=Val1,
 3278: 		 k:=Val1,l:=Val1,m:=Val1,n:=Val1,o:=Val1,
 3279: 		 p:=Val1,q:=Val1,r:=Val1,s:=Val1,t:=Val1,
 3280: 		 u:=Val1,v:=Val1,w:=Val1,x:=Val1,y:=Val1,
 3281: 		 z:=Val1,
 3282: 		 aa:=Val1,ab:=Val1,ac:=Val1,ad:=Val1,ae:=Val1,
 3283: 		 af:=Val1,ag:=Val1,ah:=Val1,ai:=Val1,aj:=Val1,
 3284: 		 ak:=Val1,al:=Val1,am:=Val1,an:=Val1,ao:=Val1,
 3285: 		 ap:=Val1,aq:=Val1,ar:=Val1,as:=Val1,at:=Val1,
 3286: 		 au:=Val1,av:=Val1,aw:=Val1,ax:=Val1,ay:=Val1,
 3287: 		 az:=Val1,
 3288: 		 K2=>[a,b,c]},
 3289: 
 3290:     %% Traverse the maps to validate them.
 3291:     _ = erlang:phash2({Map1,Map2}, 100000),
 3292: 
 3293:     _ = id({K1,K2,Val0,Val1}),			%Force use of Y registers.
 3294:     Map2.
 3295: 
 3296: do_badmap(Test) ->
 3297:     Terms = [Test,fun erlang:abs/1,make_ref(),self(),0.0/id(-1),
 3298: 	     <<0:1024>>,<<1:1>>,<<>>,<<1,2,3>>,
 3299: 	     [],{a,b,c},[a,b],atom,10.0,42,(1 bsl 65) + 3],
 3300:     [Test(T) || T <- Terms].
 3301: 
 3302: %% Use this function to avoid compile-time evaluation of an expression.
 3303: id(I) -> I.
 3304: 
 3305: 
 3306: %% OTP-13763
 3307: t_hash_entropy(Config) when is_list(Config)  ->
 3308:     %% entropy bug in 18.3, 19.0
 3309:     M1 = maps:from_list([{#{"id" => I}, ok}||I <- lists:seq(1,50000)]),
 3310: 
 3311:     #{ #{"id" => 100} := ok,
 3312:        #{"id" => 200} := ok,
 3313:        #{"id" => 300} := ok,
 3314:        #{"id" => 400} := ok,
 3315:        #{"id" => 500} := ok,
 3316:        #{"id" => 600} := ok,
 3317:        #{"id" => 700} := ok,
 3318:        #{"id" => 800} := ok,
 3319:        #{"id" => 900} := ok,
 3320:        #{"id" => 25061} := ok,
 3321:        #{"id" => 39766} := ok } = M1,
 3322: 
 3323:     M0 = maps:from_list([{I,ok}||I <- lists:seq(1,33)]),
 3324:     M2 = maps:from_list([{M0#{"id" => I}, ok}||I <- lists:seq(1,50000)]),
 3325: 
 3326:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 100}, M2),
 3327:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 200}, M2),
 3328:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 300}, M2),
 3329:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 400}, M2),
 3330:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 500}, M2),
 3331:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 600}, M2),
 3332:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 700}, M2),
 3333:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 800}, M2),
 3334:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 900}, M2),
 3335:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 25061}, M2),
 3336:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 39766}, M2),
 3337:     ok.
 3338: 
 3339: %% OTP-13146
 3340: %% Provoke major GC with a lot of "fat" maps on external format in msg queue
 3341: %% causing heap fragments to be allocated.
 3342: t_gc_rare_map_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3343:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 3344:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 3345:     try
 3346: 	Echo = spawn_link(Node, fun Loop() -> receive {From,Msg} -> From ! Msg
 3347: 					      end,
 3348: 					      Loop()
 3349: 				end),
 3350: 	FatMap = fatmap(34),
 3351: 	false = (flatmap =:= erts_internal:term_type(FatMap)),
 3352: 
 3353: 	t_gc_rare_map_overflow_do(Echo, FatMap, fun() -> erlang:garbage_collect() end),
 3354: 
 3355: 	%% Repeat test for minor gc:
 3356: 	t_gc_rare_map_overflow_do(Echo, FatMap, fun() -> minor_collect() end),
 3357: 
 3358: 	unlink(Echo),
 3359: 
 3360: 	%% Test fatmap in exit signal
 3361: 	Exiter = spawn_link(Node, fun Loop() -> receive {_From,Msg} ->
 3362: 							"not_a_map" = Msg  % badmatch!
 3363: 						end,
 3364: 						Loop()
 3365: 				  end),
 3366: 	process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 3367: 	Exiter ! {self(), FatMap},
 3368: 	{'EXIT', Exiter, {{badmatch,FatMap}, _}} = receive M -> M end,
 3369: 	ok
 3370: 
 3371:     after
 3372: 	process_flag(trap_exit, false),
 3373: 	erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
 3374: 	peer:stop(Peer)
 3375:     end.
 3376: 
 3377: t_gc_rare_map_overflow_do(Echo, FatMap, GcFun) ->
 3378:     Master = self(),
 3379:     true = receive _M -> false after 0 -> true end,   % assert empty msg queue
 3380:     Echo ! {Master, token},
 3381:     repeat(1000, fun(_) -> Echo ! {Master, FatMap} end, void),
 3382: 
 3383:     timer:sleep(100),                % Wait for maps to arrive in our msg queue
 3384:     token = receive Tok -> Tok end,  % and provoke move from outer to inner msg queue
 3385: 
 3386:     %% Do GC that will "overflow" and create heap frags due to all the fat maps
 3387:     GcFun(),
 3388: 
 3389:     %% Now check that all maps in msg queueu are intact
 3390:     %% Will crash emulator in OTP-18.1
 3391:     repeat(1000, fun(_) -> FatMap = receive FM -> FM end end, void),
 3392:     ok.
 3393: 
 3394: minor_collect() ->
 3395:     Before = minor_gcs(),
 3396:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(force_gc, self()),
 3397:     erlang:yield(),
 3398:     After = minor_gcs(),
 3399:     io:format("minor_gcs: ~p -> ~p\n", [Before, After]).
 3400: 
 3401: minor_gcs() ->
 3402:     {garbage_collection, Info} = process_info(self(), garbage_collection),
 3403:     {minor_gcs, GCS} = lists:keyfind(minor_gcs, 1, Info),
 3404:     GCS.
 3405: 
 3406: %% Generate a map with N (or N+1) keys that has an abnormal heap demand.
 3407: %% Done by finding keys that collide in the first 32-bit hash.
 3408: fatmap(N) ->
 3409:     %%erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 3410:     Table = ets:new(void, [bag, private]),
 3411: 
 3412:     Seed0 = rand:seed_s(exsplus, {4711, 3141592, 2718281}),
 3413:     Seed1 = fatmap_populate(Table, Seed0, (1 bsl 16)),
 3414:     Keys = fatmap_generate(Table, Seed1, N, []),
 3415:     ets:delete(Table),
 3416:     maps:from_list([{K,K} || K <- Keys]).
 3417: 
 3418: fatmap_populate(_, Seed, 0) -> Seed;
 3419: fatmap_populate(Table, Seed, N) ->
 3420:     {I, NextSeed} = rand:uniform_s(1 bsl 48, Seed),
 3421:     Hash = internal_hash(I),
 3422:     ets:insert(Table, [{Hash, I}]),
 3423:     fatmap_populate(Table, NextSeed, N-1).
 3424: 
 3425: 
 3426: fatmap_generate(_, _, N, Acc) when N =< 0 ->
 3427:     Acc;
 3428: fatmap_generate(Table, Seed, N0, Acc0) ->    
 3429:     {I, NextSeed} = rand:uniform_s(1 bsl 48, Seed),
 3430:     Hash = internal_hash(I),
 3431:     case ets:member(Table, Hash) of
 3432: 	true ->
 3433: 	    NewKeys = [I | ets:lookup_element(Table, Hash, 2)],
 3434: 	    Acc1 = lists:usort(Acc0 ++ NewKeys),
 3435: 	    N1 = N0 - (length(Acc1) - length(Acc0)),
 3436: 	    fatmap_generate(Table, NextSeed, N1, Acc1);
 3437: 	false ->
 3438: 	    fatmap_generate(Table, NextSeed, N0, Acc0)
 3439:     end.
 3440: 
 3441: internal_hash(Term) ->
 3442:     erts_debug:get_internal_state({internal_hash, Term}).
 3443: 
 3444:

 3522: 
 3523: %% This test case checks that the bug with ticket number OTP-15707 is
 3524: %% fixed. The bug could cause a crash or memory usage to grow until
 3525: %% the machine ran out of memory.
 3526: t_large_unequal_bins_same_hash_bug(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3527:     run_when_enough_resources(
 3528:       fun() ->
 3529:               K1 = get_4GB_bin(1),
 3530:               K2 = get_4GB_bin(2),
 3531:               Map = make_map(500),
 3532:               Map2 = maps:put(K1, 42, Map),
 3533:               %% The map needed to contain at least 32 key-value pairs
 3534:               %% at this point to get the crash or out of memory
 3535:               %% problem on the next line
 3536:               Map3 = maps:put(K2, 43, Map2),
 3537:               %% The following line should avoid that the compiler
 3538:               %% optimizes away the above
 3539:               io:format("~p ~p~n", [erlang:phash2(Map3), maps:size(Map3)])
 3540:       end).
 3541: 
 3542: make_map(0) -> 
 3543:     #{};
 3544: make_map(Size) ->
 3545:     maps:put(Size, Size, make_map(Size-1)).
 3546: 
 3547: get_4GB_bin(Value) ->
 3548:     List = lists:duplicate(65536, Value),
 3549:     Bin = erlang:iolist_to_binary(List),
 3550:     IOList4GB = duplicate_iolist(Bin, 16),
 3551:     Bin4GB = erlang:iolist_to_binary(IOList4GB),
 3552:     4294967296 = size(Bin4GB),
 3553:     Bin4GB.
 3554: 
 3555: duplicate_iolist(IOList, 0) ->
 3556:     IOList;
 3557: duplicate_iolist(IOList, NrOfTimes) ->
 3558:     duplicate_iolist([IOList, IOList], NrOfTimes - 1).
 3559: 
 3560: run_when_enough_resources(Fun) ->
 3561:     case {total_memory(), erlang:system_info(wordsize)} of
 3562:         {Mem, 8} when is_integer(Mem) andalso Mem >= 31 ->
 3563:             Fun();
 3564:         {Mem, WordSize} ->
 3565:             {skipped, 
 3566:              io_lib:format("Not enough resources (System Memory >= ~p, Word Size = ~p)",
 3567:                            [Mem, WordSize])}
 3568:     end.
 3569: 
 3570: total_memory() ->
 3571:     %% Total memory in GB.
 3572:     try
 3573: 	SMD = memsup:get_system_memory_data(),
 3574:         TM = proplists:get_value(
 3575:                available_memory, SMD,
 3576:                proplists:get_value(
 3577:                  total_memory, SMD,
 3578:                  proplists:get_value(
 3579:                    system_total_memory, SMD))),
 3580:         TM div (1024*1024*1024)
 3581:     catch
 3582: 	_ : _ ->
 3583: 	    undefined
 3584:     end.
 3585: 
 3586: %%%
 3587: %%% Benchmarks
 3588: %%%
 3589: 
 3590: -define(SMALL_MAP_SIZE, 32).
 3591: -define(BIG_MAP_SIZE, 3333).
 3592: 
 3593: benchmarks(_Config) ->
 3594:     N = 5000000,
 3595: 
 3596:     %% Looks up a known value in a flatmap and (relatively large) hashmap,
 3597:     %% the value will be near the middle of the tested flatmap in an
 3598:     %% attempt to make the test more representative.
 3599:     lookup_literal_immed_small(N),
 3600:     lookup_literal_immed_big(N),
 3601: 
 3602:     %% Looks up a value that _COULD_ be an immediate (and always is in this
 3603:     %% test), benchmarking the common case of looking up an unknown integer
 3604:     %% or similar.
 3605:     %%
 3606:     %% Like literal_immed_small, we try to pick a value that will be in the
 3607:     %% middle of the tested flatmap.
 3608:     lookup_any_immed_small(N),
 3609:     lookup_any_immed_big(N),
 3610: 
 3611:     %% Looks up `[{}]`, looking for regressions in pre-hashed complex
 3612:     %% lookups.
 3613:     lookup_literal_complex_small(N),
 3614:     lookup_literal_complex_big(N),
 3615: 
 3616:     %% Looks up some unknown complex term, looking for regressions in complex
 3617:     %% lookups that need to be hashed in runtime. 
 3618:     lookup_any_complex_small(N),
 3619:     lookup_any_complex_big(N),
 3620: 
 3621:     %% Looks up a bunch of keys in parallel, benchmarking maps-as-structs.
 3622:     lookup_literal_multi_small(N),
 3623:     lookup_literal_multi_big(N),
 3624: 
 3625:     ok.
 3626: 
 3627: lookup_literal_immed_small(Iterations) ->
 3628:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?SMALL_MAP_SIZE), []),
 3629:     F = fun(N) -> literal_immed(N, Map0, []) end,
 3630:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3631: 
 3632: lookup_literal_immed_big(Iterations) ->
 3633:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?BIG_MAP_SIZE), []),
 3634:     F = fun(N) -> literal_immed(N, Map0, []) end,
 3635:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3636: 
 3637: literal_immed(0, _Map, Acc) ->
 3638:     Acc;
 3639: literal_immed(N, Map, _) ->
 3640:     #{ (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2) := Acc } = Map,
 3641:     literal_immed(N - 1, Map, Acc).
 3642: 
 3643: lookup_any_immed_small(Iterations) ->
 3644:     Size = ?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 - 1,
 3645:     Map = maps:from_list([{V, -V} || V <- lists:seq(-Size, Size)]),
 3646:     F = fun(N) -> any_immed(N, Map, Size div 2) end,
 3647:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3648: 
 3649: lookup_any_immed_big(Iterations) ->
 3650:     Size = ?BIG_MAP_SIZE div 2 - 1,
 3651:     Map = maps:from_list([{V, -V} || V <- lists:seq(-Size, Size)]),
 3652:     F = fun(N) -> any_immed(N, Map, Size div 2) end,
 3653:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3654: 
 3655: any_immed(0, _Map, Acc) ->
 3656:     Acc;
 3657: any_immed(N, Map, Acc0) ->
 3658:     #{ Acc0 := Acc } = Map,
 3659:     any_immed(N - 1, Map, Acc).
 3660: 
 3661: lookup_literal_complex_small(Iterations) ->
 3662:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?SMALL_MAP_SIZE), []),
 3663:     F = fun(N) -> literal_complex(N, Map0#{ [{}] => [{}] }, [{}]) end,
 3664:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3665: 
 3666: lookup_literal_complex_big(Iterations) ->
 3667:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?BIG_MAP_SIZE), []),
 3668:     F = fun(N) -> literal_complex(N, Map0#{ [{}] => [{}] }, [{}]) end,
 3669:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3670: 
 3671: literal_complex(0, Map, Acc) ->
 3672:     {Map, Acc};
 3673: literal_complex(N, Map, _) ->
 3674:     #{ [{}] := Acc } = Map,
 3675:     literal_complex(N - 1, Map, Acc).
 3676: 
 3677: lookup_any_complex_small(Iterations) ->
 3678:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?SMALL_MAP_SIZE - 2), []),
 3679:     F = fun(N) ->
 3680:                 any_complex(N, Map0#{ [{}] => {[]}, {[]} => [{}] }, [{}])
 3681:         end,
 3682:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3683: 
 3684: lookup_any_complex_big(Iterations) ->
 3685:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?BIG_MAP_SIZE - 2), []),
 3686:     F = fun(N) ->
 3687:                 any_complex(N, Map0#{ [{}] => {[]}, {[]} => [{}] }, [{}])
 3688:         end,
 3689:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3690: 
 3691: any_complex(0, _Map, Acc) ->
 3692:     Acc;
 3693: any_complex(N, Map, Acc0) ->
 3694:     #{ Acc0 := Acc } = Map,
 3695:     any_complex(N - 1, Map, Acc).
 3696: 
 3697: lookup_literal_multi_small(Iterations) ->
 3698:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?SMALL_MAP_SIZE), id([])),
 3699:     F = fun(N) -> literal_multi(N, Map0, []) end,
 3700:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3701: 
 3702: lookup_literal_multi_big(Iterations) ->
 3703:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?BIG_MAP_SIZE), id([])),
 3704:     F = fun(N) -> literal_multi(N, Map0, []) end,
 3705:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3706: 
 3707: literal_multi(0, _Map, Acc) ->
 3708:     Acc;
 3709: literal_multi(N, Map, _) ->
 3710:     #{ (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 + 0) := Same,
 3711:        (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 + 1) := Same,
 3712:        (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 - 1) := Same,
 3713:        (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 + 2) := Same,
 3714:        (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 - 2) := Same } = Map,
 3715:     literal_multi(N - 1, Map, Same).
 3716: 
 3717: time(Name, F, Iterations) ->
 3718:     Time = element(1, timer:tc(F, [Iterations])),
 3719:     ct_event:notify(#event{name=benchmark_data,
 3720:                            data=[{value, Time},
 3721:                                  {suite, ?MODULE_STRING},
 3722:                                  {name, atom_to_list(Name)}]}),
 3723:     Time.
